content:
Irish: Plummer clxxxii, *Cross; Icelandic: *Boberg; Swiss: Jegerlehner
Oberwallis 301 No. 16; Spanish: Keller Espinosa Jr. No. 186; Jewish: *Neuman.
child: Mortals visited by angel in vision.
Angel announces birth of Christ to shepherds.

Angel bars abbot from his cell because abbot has cast out a
sinning monk.
Sacred books received from Buddha in person.
Precepts heard from Buddha in person.

Angels appear above grave of fallen girl through virtue of
prayers said by her lover (young monk).

content:
*DeVooys
Middelnederlandse Legenden en Exempelen (Den Haag, 1926) 129ff.; Spanish
Exempla: Keller; Jewish: *Neuman.
child: Christ born from crown of Virgin’s head.
Christ conceived on same day He was crucified.
Seventeen marvels at the birth of Christ.
Star shines through day of Nativity.
Shining cloud marks place of Nativity.
Vast intolerable light on night of Christ‘s Nativity.
Virgin suffers no birth pangs at Christ’s Nativity.
Elements silent and motionless at Nativity.

A “crown of thorns” among gifts given by the shepherds to
Joseph, husband of Virgin Mary.
Three (seven) druids come to adore infant Jesus.
Christ in form of an infant nursed by saint.
Christ in form of an infant fondled by nuns.

Christ as infant in mother‘s arms causes bare hillside to
become field of wheat as protection.
Fiery pillar as sign of Christ’s visit.
Jesus had “dark hair and a long red beard”.

Smith’s wife made nails for the Cross because her husband
believed Christ to be a true prophet.
Cross of Christ made of four kinds of wood.
Blood and wine issue from wound in side of crucified Savior.
Dialogue between Christ and the Virgin Mary.

Dialogue (debate) between Christ and Satan (at the
harrowing of hell).
The three bolts left on hell by Christ.

Irish myth: *Cross. Cf. North Carolina: Brown Collection I
642.
Christ sends message to voyaging clerics.

content:
Alphabet No. 482; *Loomis White Magic 72f.; Irish myth:
*Cross; Swiss: Jegerlehner Oberwallis 307 No. 25.
child:
Saint can perceive the thoughts of another man and reveal
hidden sins.

Truant boy learns long lesson while asleep with head in
saint‘s lap.

Saints blessed with ability to discourse in the native
idioms of the people whom they visit.
Saint understands language of wren, fly, cat.

content: Virgin Mary rescues man attacked by the devil.

*Crane Miraculis No. 23; Ward II 612 No. 30; Spanish
Exempla: Keller; West Indies: Flowers 580.
child:
Virgin Mary brings man a pact he signed with the devil and
frees the man from devil’s power.

content:
Virgin miraculously prevents nun (monk) from deserting
cloister.

Ward II 634 No. 34, 636 Nos. 7,
41, 667 No. 13, 721 No. 17; Spanish Exempla: Keller.
child: Image of Virgin tries in vain to keep nun from leaving convent.
Crane Vitry 160 No. 60; Spanish Exempla: Keller.
Angels melt snow around saintly babe.
Service of angels marks saint’s destination.
Air above grave of converted druid full of angels.

content:
Ward II 603 No. 6, 606 No. 12, 610 No. 25, 618 No. 39, 648
No. 44; Spanish Exempla: Keller.
Virgin Mary appears to erring man.
child:
Virgin Mary appears to erring monk and exalts him to
prayer.

His prayers weave her a garment.
Spanish Exempla: Keller.

Virgin Mary appears and pardons monk who has been too
overworked to pray to her.
Virgin Mary aids repentant slayer of priest.

Priest is resurrected in order to forgive murderer and
then is returned to tomb. Italian Novella: Rotunda.
Virgin Mary appears to devout nun with infant Jesus.

The nun devoutly prayed to see Him. Spanish Exempla:
Keller.

content: *Chauvin VI 106 No. 270; *Loomis White Magic 53; Irish myth: *Cross.
child: Angels sing in honor of saint.
Angel choir responds when saint receives orders.
Angels sing on night of Christ‘s Nativity.

content:
Faithfulness to Virgin Mary, even if not to Christ,
rewarded.

child: Irish saint as “Mary of the Gael”.

content:
Virgin Mary prevents (retards) death so as to save sinner’s
soul.

Permits time for repentance and
absolution. (Sometimes resuscitation.) Alphabet No. 464; Ward II 606 No. 14,
633 No. 31, 650 No. 1; *Crane Miraculis Nos. 6, 7, 10, 31, 39; Wells 169 (De
Miraculo Beate Marie); Scala Celi 123a, 125b Nos. 674, 681. -- Spanish Exempla:
Keller.
child:
Virgin Mary brings man back to life after he has seen
hell‘s torments.
Miracles of healing performed before image of Virgin Mary.
Virgin Mary restores severed hand to Saint John Damascene.

He had cut it off to repress lust. Spanish Exempla:
Keller.

Virgin Mary saves life of man who at devil‘s instigation
has castrated himself.

She will not,
however, restore his severed members. Spanish Exempla: Keller.

Virgin Mary restores life to drowned man who always had
saluted her.

*Crane Miraculis No. 12; Ward II 605ff. Nos. 10, 18, 20;
Herbert III 26; *Crane Vitry 263 No. 296.

Virgin Mary supports robber on gallows because he once said
“Ave Maria”.
Ship in storm saved because of sailors‘ “Ave Maria”.

(Cf. †D2141.1.) *Crane
Miraculis No. 28; Ward II 626 No. 9, 640 Nos. 12, 14, 15, *677 No. 12.

Because of faithfulness in saying “Aves” the words are found imprinted on the
dead man’s
tongue. (Cf. †V86.2.) Ward II 612 No. 29, 677 No. 1, cf. 632 No. 30.

Blasphemer paralyzed in all members except tongue which had
once said “Ave Maria”.
Nun forgets to hail Mary and goes into the world to sin.

Joseph and Mary threaten to leave heaven when the man who
has always prayed to them is refused admittance.
Murdered boy still sings “Ave” after his death.

(Chaucer‘s Prioress’s Tale.) **Brown PMLA XXI 486ff.; Ward
II 656, 697 and passim; Herbert III 528; Wells Catalogue of Romances 166
(Vernon Miracles).

His head calls repeatedly, “Ave Maria”. Spanish Exempla:
Keller.

Virgin Mary will not let devil (authorities) take robber
noble who daily says “Ave”.

Virgin forbids devil to take robber as long as he continues
to say two “Aves” daily.

content:
Virgin Mary has dissolute monk buried in consecrated
ground: his only mass is that of the Virgin.

*Crane Miraculis Nos. 3, 9; Ward II 607 No. 15, 660 No. 29; Scala Celi 116a,
116b Nos. 644, 645; Spanish Exempla: Keller.
child:
Devotee of Virgin not buried in consecrated ground has lily
issue from mouth so that his grave is made known.
Spanish Exempla: Keller; Italian Novella: Rotunda.
Virgin gives private mass to devout lady unable to attend.

content: Miraculous replacement of objects (animals) for saint.
child: Objects used as firewood for saint miraculously replaced.
Food (animals) eaten by saint miraculously replaced.

Loomis White Magic 70; Irish myth: *Cross; India:
Thompson-Balys.
Animals stolen from saint miraculously replaced.

Performing fox accidentally killed miraculously replaced
for saint.

Supply of lime for building church miraculously renewed for
saint.

content: Spanish: Keller, Espinosa Jr. No. 188; Jewish: *Neuman.
child:
English: Wells 76 (Joseph of Aramathie); Italian Novella:
Rotunda.
Angels appear and help boy prince slay treacherous uncle.
Angel shows saint where to dig for water.
Angel reveals location of lost (buried) object.
Angel brings cross as gift to saint.
Angel helps Peter to escape from prison.

content: Devotee of Virgin Mary given present by her.
Stella Maris: Virgin Mary as protectress of sailors.

Canney Revue de l’Histoire des Religions CXV (1937) 90ff.;
Krappe Review of Religion (1948) 376ff.

During a flood the Virgin descends into the streets to save
her image from the flood waters.

child: Flame illuminates cradle of sacred person.
Third son of king possesses sacred power.
Angel scourges mortal for disobedience to God.

content:
Angel beseeches at unholy grave of redeemed sinner until
body is moved to sanctified ground.

child: Angel leaves letter (book) with instructions for saint.
Angel tells saint where to build his church.
Angel informs saint of coming of guests.
Angels shed light upon saint’s tomb.
Angels set heavenly veil upon head of pious woman.

Saint commands return from dead with supernatural
information.

Saintly babe repeatedly found with arms extended in form of
cross.
Saint will drink only milk of cow milked by faithful woman.

Saint as baby refuses to take mother’s breast on Wednesdays
and Fridays.

Baptism of a wonder child is accompanied by a variety of
phenomena.
Place of saint‘s martyrdom perpetually green.
Martyrs emit milk instead of blood from their wounds.

Flowers grow on graves from the mouths or hearts of holy
persons.

Saint’s body remains unspoiled in the earth for a long
time.
Miracle saves saint from unjust censure.

Saint causes gluttonous reptile to leap from saint’s body
into bishop‘s throat and then return as proof of bishop’s injustice.
Seven Irish saints who never died.

Saint lives for 300 (100?) years without eating food or
uttering evil.
Saint promises to return from heaven.
Ale poisoned by druid miraculously purified by saint.

Druid raised in air, cast down, and brains scattered on stone
by power of saint.
Druid by spells seeks to drive saint from island.

Saint drives away an army by bringing upon it a dense and
smoky cloud.

(Cf. †D2163.4.) *Loomis White Magic 123; Irish myth: Cross;
India: Thompson-Balys.

Unusual fuel used by saints: burning stone, snow and
icicles, marble pillar, and green timber.
Broken objects restored to their original forms by saint.
Burned clothes restored to their previous form.
Holy man restores cut-off hands and feet.
Saint causes grey hair to grow in black.

Sinful beauty is converted and spends the end of her life
doing penance (Mary Magdalene, Mary of Egypt, and Thais).

Ground elevates itself to give protection or comfort to
saint.
Saint in anger shows strength: wall broken by his kick.

Saint disguised as poor man saves almsgiving king from
punishment in hell.
Lake of milk made through merit of saint.

Saint‘s blessing causes a river to be best place for
fishing.
Dispute between two saints settled by angel.
Objects mourn death of saint (holy man).
After birth of son holy person loses miraculous power.

House and family appear overnight to afford hospitality to
benighted priests.
Severed head of saint speaks so that searchers can find it.
Stone turns red when saint’s picture is removed.
Conversation of animals reveals to man how to become saint.

content: Holy place (object) glorified by angel‘s presence.
child: Train of angels rises from graveyard.
Angel passes daily over blessed stone.
God gives staff of Jesus to saint.

content: *Toldo II 99; Irish myth: Cross; Icelandic: Boberg.
Saints in several places at once.
Miracles performed under protection of Virgin Mary.
child:
Boy under protection of Virgin Mary pulled from well alive
after a week.
Virgin Mary saves devotee from death in waves.
Virgin Mary destroys Moorish army besieging Constantinople.
Virgin Mary saves devotee‘s son from shipwreck.
Image of Virgin Mary works miracles.
Hebrew the language of the angels.

content:
Alphabet Nos. 345, 354, 602, 637, 762; Irish: Beal XXI
305, 326, 335, O‘Suilleabhain 70f., 115; Spanish: Keller, Espinosa Jr. Nos. 45,
182; India: Thompson-Balys.
child: Birth of saint predicted by visions of miracles.
Pillar of fire rises over woman pregnant with future saint.
Saint identified by pillar of fire above her head.

Dazzling heavenly light by day and night marks place of
saint‘s birth.
Angels appear above place where saint is born.

Alphabet No. 473; Plummer cxxxviii, clxxviii; Loomis White
Magic 27f.; Irish myth: *Cross; Icelandic: *Boberg.
Supernaturally bright light marks sleeping infant saint.
Heaven falls upon infant saint. Irish myth: Cross.
Radiance fills church when saint dies.
Hand of saint made bright by Lord’s touch.

Too splendid for man‘s sight thereafter. Irish myth:
*Cross.
Column of light descends from heaven upon chosen man.
Lights show where the body of saint is buried.
Brake in which saint loses tooth bursts into flame.
House of saint filled with fragrance.
Aromatic smell of a saint’s body.
Oil bursts from ground as saint is made bishop.
Bell sounds at approach of saint.

Irish myth: Cross; England: Baughman; India:
Thompson-Balys.

Church bells ring without aid of human hands at death of
holy person.
Dead holy man stretches hand from tomb to honor saint.
Holy man passes through fire for his faith.
Only his clothing burns. Spanish Exempla: Keller.

Earthquake accompanies entrance of holy man into palace of
heathen emperor.

Saint falling into an abyss found perched in the branches
of a tree which projected from the cliff.
As soon as the man is drawn up, the tree vanishes. *Loomis White Magic 127.
Flowers fall from saint‘s mouth while he speaks.
Holy man restores a garden to bloom.

Sun sends shaft of heat to cook meat given persecuted
saint.
Roses lose thorns when saint walks on them.

Saint changes maggots in the sores of a nun into precious
stones.

Robbers who enter saint’s garden to steal are caused to
spade it up for him.

This proves him to be
saint. Spanish Exempla: Keller.

content:
Encyc. Rel. Ethics Index 246a; Irish myth: *Cross; India:
Thompson-Balys; Icelandic: *Boberg.
child: Oil flowing from relics has curative powers.

The wine (water) occasionally used to bathe relics assumes
healing powers.
Shrine of saint carried around to suppress pestilence.
Crippled saint miraculously receives horse and chariot.
Miraculous healing power of saint as child.
Leper cured by the kiss of a saint.
Saint’s blessing sufficient to control a mad dog.
Saint purifies monk with sign of the cross.

Woman relieved of incurable malady by kissing letter from
saint.
Wounds cured by saint leave no scars.
Cut off parts of body attached again by saint.
Men with enormous and unnatural appetite cured by saint.

content: Portrait of the Virgin appears to devotee.

Virgin Mary supplies mead for unprepared hostess of the
king.
Virgin Mary designates favorite for election for office.
child:
Virgin restores office to an ignorant man because of his
faith.
Virgin pardons man who repented for cheating in election.
Saint drinks poison without being injured.

content:
*Chauvin VI 184 No. 349; *Fb “engel” I 250; Jewish: *Neuman, bin Gorion Born
Judas I 313f., 149f., 371ff., 380.
child: Angel of death spares mother who is suckling children.

content: Spanish Exempla: Keller; Icelandic: Boberg; Jewish: *Neuman.
child:
Angel appears to woman to warn her not to force girl into
marriage.
Angel in the form of an old man.

content: Devotee of Virgin is comforted in the hour of death.
Angel bars the way to Baalam‘s ass.

Alphabet No. 381;
Wesselski Mönchslatein 78 No. 68; *Crane Miraculis No. 34; Icelandic: Boberg.
child: Virgin Mary returns borrowed money and reveals cheat.

A man borrows money from a Jew with the Virgin as
security. Unable to return the money in time, he commits the money to the sea
with a prayer to the Virgin. The Jew receives it but claims that the money is
not paid. The Virgin reveals the cheat. Ward II 638 No. 10; *Crane Miraculis
No. 33; Wells 167 (Vernon Miracles).
Virgin Mary saves criminal from fire at stake.
